item.title: China and Canada Edge Closer With Progress on Trade
item.description: Prime Minister Mark Carney’s visit to Beijing yields agreement on a “strategic partnership,” as China seeks to court countries grappling with volatile U.S. trade policies.
item.dc:creator: Yoko Kubota

item.title: With Military Action on Hold, the U.S. Puts New Sanctions on Iran
item.description: The economic penalties target the leaders of a bloody crackdown and companies that support Tehran’s illicit oil trade.
item.dc:creator: Omar Abdel-Baqui

item.title: Halliburton and Its Rivals Can’t Wait to Get Back Into Venezuela
item.description: When it comes to stepping up Venezuelan oil production, investors bet that the early returns will go to oil-field services companies.
item.dc:creator: Ryan Dezember

item.title: Canadian Leader Spurned by Trump Finds a Warm Embrace in China
item.description: Beijing is hosting Mark Carney as it works to sustain its exports and woo U.S. allies frustrated with American protectionism.
item.dc:creator: Paul Vieira

item.title: Chinese AI Developers Say They Can’t Beat America Without Better Chips
item.description: Companies in China are jostling for access to Nvidia’s latest Rubin lineup while better-funded U.S. competitors are first in line.
item.dc:creator: Tracy Qu

item.title: Trump Accepts Machado’s Nobel Peace Prize During White House Visit
item.description: Venezuela’s opposition leader had hoped to shore up support the president’s support, but she left the meeting with little to show.
item.dc:creator: Kejal Vyas

item.title: ‘A Massacre Happened’: The 24 Hours That Bloodied Iran
item.description: Authorities shut down the internet on Jan. 8. Then the large-scale killings began.
item.dc:creator: Margherita Stancati

item.title: Trump Was Told Attack on Iran Wouldn’t Guarantee Collapse of Regime
item.description: The president was advised that the U.S. military would need more firepower in Middle East to launch a large-strike attack.

item.title: Opinion | David Webb, Transparency Advocate
item.description: His Webb-site published corporate and public records in Hong Kong.
item.dc:creator: The Editorial Board

item.title: Opinion | Operation Total Nuuk Submission
item.description: Trump has already been offered free rein in Greenland. He should accept victory.
item.dc:creator: Kimberley A. Strassel

item.title: Europe Deploys Troops to Greenland in Message to Trump
item.description: In a first for NATO, America’s closest allies are using their troops to thwart possible U.S. action.
item.dc:creator: Drew Hinshaw

item.title: Taiwan Pledges $250 Billion in U.S. Spending in Exchange for Lower Tariffs
item.description: Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing will add new factories to its cluster in Arizona as part of a $250 billion investment in the U.S.
item.dc:creator: Amrith Ramkumar

item.title: Opinion | President Trump’s Path to Victory in Tehran
item.description: We must not miss this opportunity.

item.title: U.S. Forces Seize Sixth Oil Tanker Near Venezuela
item.description: The U.S. military is targeting the shadow fleet of vessels carrying sanctioned crude.

item.title: British American Tobacco to End South African Manufacturing
item.description: BAT South Africa said it would cease cigarette production in the country because of “the devastating impact of the illicit cigarette trade”.

item.title: Maersk to Resume Sailing Through Red Sea
item.description: Maersk will resume sailing through the Red Sea and Suez Canal following improved stability in the area, but said it will continue to monitor the security situation closely.
item.dc:creator: Dominic Chopping

item.title: Iran’s Heavy Crackdown Quells Protests
item.description: An internet shutdown has made it difficult to determine the scale of the demonstrations, but some Iranians say an eerie quiet has taken over.
item.dc:creator: Benoit Faucon

item.title: China’s Propaganda Playbook for Targeting Rivals
item.description: China’s state propaganda machine has a toolbox for undermining leaders that includes fake opinion polls, “lawfare” and general character assassination.

item.title: The Two Faces of Venezuela’s Regime Smile at the U.S. and Glower at Home
item.description: After the ouster of Nicolás Maduro, the entrenched Venezuelan leadership has softened its tone toward Washington—while anti-American rhetoric endures.
item.dc:creator: Ryan Dubé

item.title: Trump’s Military Buildup in Caribbean Limits His Options in Iran
item.description: Though no U.S. aircraft-carrier strike group is in the Middle East, officials insist there are sufficient military assets in the region to strike Iran.

item.title: Welcome to Greenland, an Economy Reliant on Subsidies and Shrimp
item.description: Greenlanders get heavily subsidized by Denmark, and any future mining boom will be costly.
item.dc:creator: Max Colchester

item.title: Trump Says Iran Has Stopped Killing Protesters
item.description: The Oval Office comments came after the U.S. evacuated some personnel from a Qatar air base in a move described as a precaution.

item.title: Opinion | Where’s Congress on Russia Sanctions?
item.description: Trump has given the green light for a tariff bill on countries that buy Russian oil.

item.title: Opinion | India’s Timid Economic Reforms
item.description: Modi tinkers with the rules to make them slightly less oppressive, but the country needs a free-market overhaul.

item.title: Opinion | My Country, Somaliland, Recognized
item.description: Our first embassy will be in the Jewish state, whose aspirations and history we share.

item.title: Iran Signals Plans for Swift Trials and Executions of Protesters
item.description: The regime’s top judicial official has called for quick action against protesters convicted of vandalism and other offenses.

item.title: European Defense Companies in Line to Benefit From Bulk of EU’s $105 Billion Ukraine Loan
item.description: Ukraine must buy weapons and military platforms from European manufacturers, unless they aren’t able to supply what Kyiv needs.

item.title: Japan’s New Prime Minister Set to Call Snap Election
item.description: Sanae Takaichi hopes to cement her grip on power as she battles Chinese anger over remarks she made about Taiwan.

item.title: China Imports to Help Lower U.K. Inflation to Target, BOE’s Taylor Says
item.description: The annual rate of inflation is likely to fall to the Bank of England’s 2% target by the middle of this year, aided by cheap imports from China, the rate-setter said.

item.title: China’s Record Trade Surplus Defies Expectations for Tariff-Driven Slowdown
item.description: The 2025 record showed that the world’s second-largest economy remained resilient despite facing steep Trump administration tariffs that slashed its exports to the U.S.

item.title: Venezuela Frees Detained Americans in Slow Release of Political Prisoners

item.title: Trump Tells Iranian Protesters ‘Help Is On Its Way’

item.title: The Battle Over Who Runs the Panama Canal Ports Is About to Be Decided
item.description: The Panamanian Supreme Court is winding up deliberations in a lawsuit that could void a Chinese company’s license to operate the ports and hand President Trump a win.

item.title: U.K. House Prices Expected to Rise But London Likely to Straggle
item.description: U.K. house prices are expected to rise in 2026, with Scotland and Northern England showing the strongest growth and sales prospects, according to real-estate website Zoopla.

item.title: Military Experts Reject Trump’s Logic That U.S. Must Own Greenland to Defend It
item.description: The U.S. president’s assertion runs counter to decades of policy and undermines deterrence, say former military and diplomatic officials.

item.title: A Custody Battle Over Dogs Rocks an African Nation
item.description: Palace guard dogs are said to protect Malawi’s president from intruders and witchcraft. The outgoing leader decided to keep a few.

item.title: Canada Anticipates Progress in China Talks to Resolve Trade Row
item.description: Canada anticipates progress with China on resolving trade irritants regarding canola and electric vehicles during Prime Minister Mark Carney visit’s to Beijing this week, officials said.

item.title: Australia’s Critical Minerals Reserve to First Focus on Antimony, Gallium, Rare Earths

item.title: China Detains Church Leaders as Crackdown on Religion Intensifies
item.description: Authorities have taken away at least four members of a high-profile “house church” in Sichuan province as a campaign to root out religious organizations beyond the state’s control intensifies.

item.title: Thailand, Cambodia Agree to Immediate Cease-Fire in Border Clashes

item.title: India Is on a Himalayan Building Spree to Prepare for a Clash With China
item.description: A deadly standoff jolted India to stitch together a huge network of roads, tunnels and landing strips needed to move soldiers and supplies to the mountainous border region.

item.title: U.K. Inflation Slows to Eight-Month Low as BOE Prepares Rate Decision
item.description: Prices cooled more than expected in November, keeping the Bank of England on course for a fourth interest-rate cut of the year.

item.title: Charles III Gives ‘Good News’ on Cancer Treatment

item.title: ‘India’ and ‘Let My Country Awake’ Review: History at an Audacious Scale
item.description: Audrey Truschke’s single-volume work makes a bold attempt to capture thousands of years of cultural ferment on the Indian subcontinent.
